author: Teresa
text: The RealReal SOHO “lost” 12 of the 13 consignment items I gave them. I brought them to the store on October 19. It took until mid December for them to own up that my items were gone. It’s now the beginning of March & I’m still not totally repaid. The work I put into getting restitution was heroic. The amount I received was abysmal. NEVER EVER again with TRR. I’ll shout it from the rooftops & post it on Yelp.
title: SELLER BEWARE of TRR

author: customer annoyed with shipping
text:
Shipping charges are outrageous!!
Not only is not free, but it’s more expensive than most other sites that’ charge shipping IF you spend under a certain amount. 
Why don’t you give the option to ship from your warehouse to a store to pick up.  For free like almost every other retailer.  The limited amount of in store pickup only if the store happens to have isn’t enough.  You should offer to ship all merch to the store for free.  Better carbon footprint too which TRR is so quick to point out in other facets of the business.
title: Shipping charges are outrageous!!

author: customer
text: From the beginning my experience has been a complete disappointment. I was told that you sold certain items and was encouraged to send them to only have them denied because you do not sell them. It took weeks to finally get them returned to me. I sent in a $3k in retail value RL Purple Label Tuxedo with the tags on it for you to separate it, Mia label the items as a blazer and dress pants, and sell it off for a fraction of the value. I was told by someone on the phone and in email that you would supplement the amount owed to me to compensate for the error but I never have received these funds after the blazer sold. When it was returned you had an opportunity to pair the tuxedo as it should be but instead you sold the jacket again while the pants remain marked as “accepted” looking like there is no intention to try and sell them. The entire experience has me never wanting to consign or purchase from your platform.
title: Extremely disappointed
